title: Elegant condensed sans serif
content:
Hello experts,

I would love to know the name of this beautiful typeface.

Cheers  
L.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820062707im_/http:/typophile.com/files/menyomslag_6392.jpg)
author: laurent

comments.content: Thanks to [this sample](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820062707/http:/www.designbasen.no/getfile.php/Bilder_Designbasen%20brukere/Bilder/Firma/Prosjekt/uni_webref_grilleriet_underside%201.jpg%20%28640x315%29.jpg), I'd say it should be [Alternate Gothic No 1](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820062707/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/alternate-gothic) with a custom /G (may be started from /O)

Thanks for your time Ryuk, your sample is great !

I think [Grotseque MT extra condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820062707/http:/myfonts.us/td-kRQj5z) is closer, still not perfect though.

Right. MT Grotesque Extra Condensed (MTGEC) is close but, even if /G could appear to come closer, that's doubtlessly Alternate Gothic No 1 (AGNO1) with a custom /G: /R bowler connection with vertical stem is oblique for AGNO1 and horizontal for MTGEC, MTGEC weight not enough bold, MTGEC /E middle bar too short while AGNO1 one is matching...
